conclusion: Analyze the motion of particles A and B based on their velocity-time graph.
The graph shows the velocity of each particle as a function of time.
Both particles start from rest at the same time, so their initial velocity is v_0.
For particle A, the velocity is 2v_0 from t_0 to 3t_0.
For particle B, the velocity is v_0 from t_0 to 3t_0.
From t_0 to 3t_0, particle A travels 6v_0 t_0.
From t_0 to 3t_0, particle B travels 3v_0 t_0.
The distance between A and B is the absolute difference in their positions: 3v_0 t_0.
The time when they are farthest apart is when the distance is maximized.
The distance is maximized at t = 3t_0.
Verify that this time satisfies the conditions of both particles starting from rest at the same time and moving in the same direction.
Conclude that the particles are farthest apart at t = 3t_0.
